Name: Slow Comfortable Screw Against a Cold Hard Wall
Ingredients: 15 ml Southern/Louisiana-style whisky liqueur (e.g. Southern Comfort)
Instructions: STIR first four ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass. Then FLOAT Galliano and overproof rum.
Review: Sloe gin is the 'Slow', Sothern Comfort is the 'Comfortable', vodka and orange juice are the 'Screw' (as in Screwdriver ), ice is the 'Cold', overproof rum the 'Hard' and Galliano the 'Wall' (as in Harvey Wallbanger ). The result is a much better drink than the sleazy name might suggest, at least it is when freshly squeezed orange juice is used.
History: Origins and evolution of the "Slow Screw" family of cocktails .
Nutrition: One serving of Slow Comfortable Screw Against a Cold Hard Wall contains 256 calories
